summary: This Haskell code defines a function `noto` which takes a Boolean and returns a string indicating whether the number is even or odd. The `eveno` function checks if a number is even, and `main` demonstrates using composition to test `noto` with an example input of 16.

details.comment: This Haskell code defines a function `noto` which takes a Boolean and returns a string indicating whether the number is even or odd. The `eveno` function checks if a number is even, and `main` demonstrates using composition to test `noto` with an example input of 16.
details.content:
noto  :: Bool -> String 
eveno x = if x `rem` 2 == 0 
   then True 
else False 
noto x = if x == True 
   then "This is an even Number" 
else "This is an ODD number" 
main = do 
   putStrLn "Example of Haskell Function composition" 
   print ((noto.eveno) 16 )
